instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Liquid damage:
- <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is missing (fixed)
- Replaced J8300 (looks like a shit before)

Everything works fine, but get really hot and shut down after 5-7min
Did you guys can help me?

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Run ASD first.....

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: 156 should work as the 3437 is just a mid 2013 board.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Try another camera connector from a cracked LCD assembly. The ASD sensor can cause problems. Also you EFI version of ASD!

The problem is the cable, [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] . Right now, the only problem is the speed of the fan.
Keep the CPU cold, but spinning really fast. What u think about that? Can i check another thing?

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
My only problem is the fan speed. 
The CPU get hot, but the fan still spinning in the same speed if i plug all the cables.
Without Power Audio Board Cable 821-1722-A , the fan spinning really fast and make the CPU a little bit more cold.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Boot in OSX and install iStat and report CPU temperature.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Just fixed:
The problem is:
Power Audio Board Cable 821-1722-A

Thanks for guide me [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yeah that cable will really heat up the CPU! :(
